resources.string: This app is created by Karlo Yu.
This tool is an attempt to provide a well information related to the Coronavirus (COVID-19).
The Covid-19 affects people in different ways.
Check how to prevent and slow transmission of Covid-19
You can reduce your chances of being infected or spreading COVID-19 by taking some simple precautions.
Washing your hands especially after you have been in a public place kills viruses that may be on your hands.

Regularly and thoroughly wash your hands with soap and running water for at least 20 seconds.


Use an alcohol-based, at least 60% alcohol, hand sanitizers if soap and water are not readily available.


Avoid touching your eyes, nose, and mouth with unwashed hands.
Where people come together in crowds, you are more likely to come into close contact with someone that has COVID-19.

Stay at least 6 feet (about 2 armsâ€™ length) from other people outside of your home.\n\n
Avoid close contact with people who are sick, even inside your home.
Following a good respiratory hygiene such as covering your mouth and nose with a cloth face mask ensures the prevention of spreading of COVID-19 even if you don\'t feel sick.

Everyone should wear a cloth face mask when they have to go out in public.


The cloth face mask is meant to protect other people in case you are infected.


The cloth face mask is not a substitute for social distancing.


When you cough or sneeze, use the inside of your elbow for cover if you don't have on your cloth face mask.
More information at WHO and CDC website.

string.name: cdc
string.a: Center for Disease Control and Prevention

resources.string: COVID-19 is a respiratory condition. Most people will have mild symptoms and get better on their own. There are wide range of symptoms reported.

People can catch COVID-19 from others who have the virus. It spreads primarily from person to person through small droplets. \n\nSymptoms may appear 2-14 days after exposure to the virus. People with these symptoms may have COVID-19:

Aches and pains


Sore throat


Diarrhoea


Conjunctivitis


Headache


Loss of taste or smell


skin rash or discolouration of fingers or toes

Difficulty breathing or shortness of breath


Chest pain


Loss of speech or movement
If someone is showing any of these symptoms, seek medical attention immediately.
More information at WHO and CDC website.
